title: NZ's Sky Network extends broadcast deal with certain rugby unions
text:
NZ's Sky Network extends broadcast deal with certain rugby unions

Stock Markets 2 hours ago (Oct 13, 2019 22:40)

© Reuters. NZ's Sky Network extends broadcast deal with certain rugby unions Oct 14 (Reuters) - New Zealand's Sky Network Television said on Monday it reached a broadcast deal with the New Zealand, Australian, South African and Argentinian Rugby Unions. The five-year agreement extends Sky's existing SANZAAR broadcast rights to 2025. SANZAAR is the body that operates Super Rugby and The Rugby Championship competitions in Rugby Union. The deal also includes New Zealand Rugby picking up a 5% equity stake in Sky, which will involve the television broadcaster issuing 21.8 million shares to NZR on Nov. 1 as part of the payment, worth about NZ$19.4 million as of Sky's last close.
